Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a drab-coloured pottery meat(?)-jar, the fabric contains many small white inclusions, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip and faint traces of two lines of black-painted hieratic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393476) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393476)
